Question Text: The customer edge device is typically a router, that sits at a customer site on MPLS networks and connects to a provider edge router (PE router) to take communications from a customer site to a provider side.
LLM Explanation: The statement is true. In an MPLS network, the customer edge (CE) device, typically a router, is located at the customer's premises. It connects to the provider edge (PE) router, which is the entry point into the service provider's MPLS network. The CE router is responsible for forwarding customer traffic to the PE router, which then uses MPLS labels to transport the traffic across the provider's network to the destination.
URLs: ['MPLS Fundamentals by Luc De Ghein, Cisco Press', 'RFC 4364 - BGP/MPLS IP Virtual Private Networks (VPNs)', 'Cisco Documentation: MPLS VPN Technology Overview']

Question Text: ____________________ is a network design that connects a link between each pair of nodes.
Choices:
a. Full Mesh
b. Star
c. Hybrid
d. Partial Mesh
LLM Explanation: A full mesh network topology is one where every node (device) is connected to every other node in the network. This means there is a direct link between each pair of nodes, allowing for maximum redundancy and performance. However, this also makes full mesh very costly and impractical for large networks due to the high number of connections required.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Volume 1 by Wendell Odom', 'https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/ios-nx-os-software/what-is-network-topology.html']

Question Text: With PoE, a LAN switch can act as the Power Sourcing Equipment (PSE).
LLM Explanation: With Power over Ethernet (PoE), a LAN switch can indeed act as the Power Sourcing Equipment (PSE). The PSE is responsible for providing power over the Ethernet cable to powered devices (PDs) such as IP phones, wireless access points, or IP cameras. The PSE can be either an endspan (a PoE-capable Ethernet switch) or a midspan (a standalone PoE injector). Therefore, the statement is true.
URLs: ['Cisco Press: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Volume 1 by Wendell Odom', 'IEEE 802.3af and 802.3at standards for Power over Ethernet']

Question Text: Which of the following roles of campus switches provides a connection point for end-user devices?
Choices:
a. Access
b. Distribution
c. Core
d. Campus
LLM Explanation: The access layer of campus switches provides a connection point for end-user devices to connect to the network. Access layer switches are typically located close to end users and provide network access for devices such as computers, IP phones, printers, and more. The other layers - distribution and core - aggregate access layer switches and provide interconnectivity between network segments, but do not directly connect end-user devices.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Volume 1, Chapter 3: Fundamentals of LANs and Ethernet - Campus LAN Design Terminology and Concepts', 'Cisco Press: Enterprise Campus Network Design Model - Access Layer']

Question Text: Which of the following roles of campus switches provides an aggregation point for access switches?
Choices:
a. Access
b. Distribution
c. Core
d. Campus
LLM Explanation: In a hierarchical campus network design, the distribution layer switches provide an aggregation point for the access layer switches. The distribution layer aggregates the traffic from multiple access layer switches before it is forwarded to the core layer. The distribution layer can also provide other functions such as routing, access control, and QoS.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Volume 1, by Wendell Odom, Chapter 3: Fundamentals of LANs', 'CCNP and CCIE Enterprise Core ENCOR 350-401 Official Cert Guide by Bradley Edgeworth, Jason Gooley, David Hucaby, Ramiro Garza Rios, Chapter 1: Campus Network Architecture']

Question Text: Which of the following roles of campus switches aggregates distribution switches in very large campus LANs?
Choices:
a. Access
b. Distribution
c. Core
d. Campus
LLM Explanation: In very large campus LANs, the core layer switches aggregate the distribution layer switches. The core layer provides high-speed switching and scalability, acting as the backbone of the network to efficiently transfer data between distribution layer devices.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Volume 1 by Wendell Odom, Chapter 3: Fundamentals of LANs and Ethernet', 'Cisco Press: Campus Network Architecture and Design - https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=2202410&seqNum=4']

Question Text: Your company plans to start using public cloud service and now you are considering different WAN options. Your main concern is security by keeping the data private while also providing good QoS services. Which of the following options are under consideration? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. Using private WAN connections directly to the cloud provider
b. Using an Internet connection without VPN
c. Using an Internet connection with VPN
d. Using an intercloud exchange
LLM Explanation: When connecting to public cloud services, the two best options for maintaining data privacy and providing good QoS are: a) Using private WAN connections directly to the cloud provider, and c) Using an Internet connection with VPN. Private WAN connections, like dedicated leased lines or MPLS, provide secure, isolated connectivity to the cloud provider's network. A VPN over the public Internet encrypts the data, keeping it private, while also allowing QoS policies to prioritize critical traffic. The other choices, using the Internet without VPN or an intercloud exchange, do not inherently provide the required level of security and QoS control for this scenario.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Wendell Odom, Cisco Press, 2020', 'Cisco SD-WAN: Cloud Scale Architecture, Kiran Ghodgaonkar, Cisco Press, 2022', 'Cisco Networking Academy: Introduction to Networks v7.0, Cisco Press, 2020']
SM - Description: Does not identify that VLAN would not be good for QoS. Not talking about cloud exchanges

Question Text: One of the differences between Public Cloud and Private Cloud (On-Premise) is that on the Public Cloud solution you are responsible for all management, maintenance, and updating of data centers.
LLM Explanation: The statement is false. In a public cloud solution, the cloud service provider is responsible for managing, maintaining, and updating the data centers. The customer is not responsible for these tasks. This is one of the key advantages of using public cloud services - the provider takes care of the underlying infrastructure. In contrast, with a private cloud (on-premise) solution, the organization owns and is responsible for managing and maintaining their own data centers.

Question Text: A company uses a Metro Ethernet WAN with an Ethernet LAN (E-LAN) service, with the company headquarters plus 20 remote sites connected to the service. The enterprise uses OSPF at all sites, with one router connected to the service from each site. Which of the following are true about the Layer 3 details most likely used with this service and design? (Choose all that apply)
Choices:
a. The WAN uses one IP subnet
b. The WAN uses 20 or more IP subnets
c. A remote site router would have one OSPF neighbor
d. A remote site router would have 20 OSPF neighbors
LLM Explanation: In a Metro Ethernet WAN with E-LAN service, all sites are connected to a single Layer 2 domain, effectively forming a single IP subnet (choice a). Each remote site router would have a single OSPF neighbor relationship with the headquarters router over this shared Layer 2 network (choice c). The network does not require multiple IP subnets for connectivity between sites (eliminates choice b), and a remote site router would not form OSPF neighbor relationships with the other remote site routers, only with the headquarters router (eliminates choice d).
URLs: ['Cisco Press CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Part 2, Chapter 16: WAN Concepts', 'Cisco Documentation: Layer 2 WAN Architecture Overview (https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/Enterprise/WAN_and_MAN/L2WAN_Arch_Oview.html)']
SM - Description: Misinterprets the context, not all routers are connected to the headquarters
Effect - Description of effects: Might make it harder to debug

Question Text: The process of dividing a physical server into multiple unique and isolated virtual servers by means of a software application is called server _________________.
Choices:
a. Integration
b. Isolation
c. Virtualization
d. Segmentation
LLM Explanation: Server virtualization is the process of dividing a physical server into multiple unique and isolated virtual servers using software. It allows one physical server to run multiple operating systems and applications, each in its own isolated environment or virtual machine (VM). This enables more efficient utilization of physical server resources.

Question Text: Which cloud “As a Service” model is a form of cloud computing that delivers fundamental compute, network, and storage resources to consumers on-demand, over the internet, and on a pay-as-you-go basis?
Choices:
a. Software as a Service
b. Platform as a Service
c. Infrastructure as a Service
d. Database as a Service
LLM Explanation: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) is the cloud computing model that provides fundamental compute, network, and storage resources to consumers on-demand, over the internet, and on a pay-as-you-go basis. IaaS allows users to rent IT infrastructure from a cloud provider, including servers, virtual machines, storage, networks, and operating systems.

Question Text: Which cloud “As a Service” model is a software distribution model in which a third-party provider hosts applications and makes them available to customers over the Internet?
Choices:
a. Software as a Service
b. Platform as a Service
c. Infrastructure as a Service
d. Database as a Service
LLM Explanation: Software as a Service (SaaS) is a software distribution model in which a third-party provider hosts applications and makes them available to customers over the Internet. In this model, the provider manages the infrastructure, platform, and software, while the customer accesses the application through a web browser or API. Examples of SaaS include Google Apps, Salesforce, and Microsoft Office 365.

Question Text: Which cloud “As a Service” model is a complete development and deployment environment in the cloud, with resources that enable you to deliver everything from simple cloud-based apps to sophisticated, cloud-enabled enterprise applications?
Choices:
a. Software as a Service
b. Platform as a Service
c. Infrastructure as a Service
d. Database as a Service
LLM Explanation: Platform as a Service (PaaS) provides a complete development and deployment environment in the cloud. It includes infrastructure (servers, storage, networking) as well as development tools, database management systems, business intelligence services, and more. PaaS allows developers to create, run, and manage applications without the complexity of building and maintaining the underlying infrastructure. It supports the complete web application lifecycle from development and testing to deployment and hosting.
